Class turboRegImage

java.lang.Object
  turboRegImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
 class turboRegImage
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

This class is responsible for the image preprocessing that takes place concurrently with user-interface events. It contains methods to compute B-spline coefficients and their pyramids, image pyramids, gradients, and gradient pyramids.

Constructor Detail

turboRegImage

public turboRegImage(ij.ImagePlus imp,
                     int transformation,
                     boolean isTarget)
Converts the pixel array of the incoming ImagePlus object into a local float array.

Parameters:
imp - ImagePlus object to preprocess.
transformation - Transformation code.
isTarget - Tags the current object as a target or source image.
Method Detail

getCoefficient

public float[] getCoefficient()
Return the B-spline coefficients of the full-size image.

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Return the full-size image height.

getImage

public float[] getImage()
Return the full-size image array.

getPyramid

public java.util.Stack<java.lang.Object> getPyramid()
Return the image pyramid as a Stack object. The organization of the stack depends on whether the turboRegImage object corresponds to the target or the source image, and on the transformation (ML* = {TRANSLATION,RIGID_BODY, SCALED_ROTATION, AFFINE} vs. ML = {BILINEAR}). A single pyramid level consists of

isTarget ML* ML
true width
height
B-spline coefficients		 width
height
samples
false width
height
samples
horizontal gradients
vertical gradients		 width
height
B-spline coefficients

getPyramidDepth

public int getPyramidDepth()
Return the depth of the image pyramid. A depth 1 means that one coarse resolution level is present in the stack. The full-size level is not placed on the stack.

getThread

public java.lang.Thread getThread()
Return the thread associated with this turboRegImage object.

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Return the full-size image width.

getXGradient

public float[] getXGradient()
Return the full-size horizontal gradient of the image, if available.

See Also:
getPyramid()

getYGradient

public float[] getYGradient()
Return the full-size vertical gradient of the image, if available.

See Also:
getImage()

run

public void run()
Start the image precomputations. The computation of the B-spline coefficients of the full-size image is not interruptible; all other methods are.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

setPyramidDepth

public void setPyramidDepth(int pyramidDepth)
Sets the depth up to which the pyramids should be computed.
